title: SL’s digital backbone under threat?
byline: Several key online government services were hit by a sudden technical failure in the Lanka Government Cloud (LGC), raising alarm over a possible data breach that may have exposed sensitive citizen and official information.

title: Ishara Sewwandi arrested in Nepal
byline: Five individuals, including the main suspect Ishara Sewwandi, wanted in connection with the murder of organized crime gang leader Ganemulla Sanjeewa, have been arrested in Nepal.

title: Laugfs Gas suspends Dubai unit after US sanctions
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC announced on Monday its decision to temporarily suspend all commercial operations of its Dubai-based subsidiary, SLOGAL Energy DMCC, following its designation on a sanctions list by the US Treasury.

title: Former Navy Commander Ulugetenne granted bail
byline: Former Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne, who was in remand custody in connection with the disappearance of a youth from Pothuhera, was granted bail by the Kurunegala Magistrate’s Court today.

title: ’’Bus Lalith” arrested in Dubai over criminal charges
byline: Lalith Kannangara, widely known as “Bus Lalith,” a member of a criminal gang, has been arrested in Dubai.

title: WHO warns of contaminated India cough syrups
byline: The World Health Organization on Monday issued a health advisory warning about three contaminated cough syrups identified in India, urging authorities to report any detection of these medicines in their countries to the health agency.

title: Court finds no grounds to grant anticipatory bail to Manusha Nanayakkara
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today rejected the anticipatory bail application filed by former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, seeking to be released on bail in the event of being arrested by the Bribery Commission.

title: Shashindra Rajapaksa granted bail after over 70 days in remand
byline: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa, who had been in remand custody over allegations of committing offences under the Public Property Act, was today ordered to be released on bail by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: Joint Opposition wins all seats in Thelikada Majuwana Cooperative Society
byline: The Joint Opposition scored yet another victory when the group backed by them secured the Thelikada Majuwana Cooperative Society with six members being elected to the management.

title: CEB trade unions to suspend TU action
byline: All trade unions of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) have decided to suspend their trade union action that they had launched from September 4.

title: Gotabaya refutes any connection to controversial building in Kataragama
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa refuted recent media reports linking his name to a building near the Menik Ganga in Kataragama, stating that he has no connections whatsoever to the said property.

title: PUCSL decides not to increase electricity tariffs
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has decided not to increase electricity tariffs this time.

title: ETA mandatory for tourists arriving Sri Lanka from tomorrow
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration today announced that all foreign nationals visiting Sri Lanka on tourism or business trips are required to obtain an Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) prior to their arrival from tomorrow (15).

title: Sri Lanka records 1.79M tourists in 2025 so far
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) announced that 1,788,235 tourists visited Sri Lanka in 2025 up to now, with 62,741 arrivals during the first 12 days of October 2025.

title: ’SuwaSeriya’ cannot be changed without changing law: Harsha
byline: SJB MP Harsha De Silva said if the name ’SuwaSeriya’ is to be changed from the 1990 emergency ambulance service, the law must be changed, and necessary accreditations must be obtained.

title: Chinese President meets Harini Amarasuriya in Beijing
byline: Chinese President Xi Jinping met with Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Tuesday, during her visit to China to attend the Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women.

title: Cabinet nod to import Ponni Samba
byline: The Cabinet has granted approval for importers to bring in up to 520 metric tonnes of Ponni Samba rice per importer without the need for import permits.

title: Google to invest $15bn to build AI data hub in India
byline: Google’s parent company Alphabet will invest $15bn (£11.29bn) to build an AI data hub in southern India’s Andhra Pradesh state.

title: Easter Sunday attacks: Writ against Nilantha Jayawardhane fixed for support
byline: A writ petition filed seeking an order to conduct a credible investigation and take appropriate action against Senior DIG Nilantha Jayawardane for his alleged omission and serious dereliction of duty that led to the Easter Sunday bombings in 2019 was fixed for support by the Court of Appeal.

title: Motor Traffic services running normally, no disruptions
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic announced that all services are proceeding normally without any disruptions, dismissing recent media reports of a technical glitch halting the services of several government institutions.

title: Police confiscate assets worth Rs. 3.9 billion from organized criminals
byline: Police Media Spokesperson ASP F.U.K. Wootler said that assets valued at Rs. 3,902 million belonging to organized criminals have been confiscated following investigations carried out between 2021 and 2024.

title: Increased rainfall forecast in coming days due to atmospheric disturbances
byline: The Meteorology Department warned of a high possibility of increased rainfall in the coming days as the Intertropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ) is currently influencing the weather over the island.

title: Hats off to PUCSL for blocking power tariff hike: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today lauded the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) for blocking the 6.8 per cent power tariff hike proposed by the government.

title: Nine killed in fire at garment factory in Bangladesh
byline: At least nine people were killed and several injured after a fire consumed a garment factory and a chemical warehouse in Bangladesh’s capital Dhaka on Tuesday.

title: ’’Fully utilize funds without returning them to Treasury’’: Prez to officials
byline: The President instructed officials to fully utilize the financial allocations provided for this year’s development projects without returning them to the Treasury, stressing that failure to do so would not only hinder development but also result in wastage of public funds.

title: Over 60% of casino players gamble online
byline: It has been revealed that more than 60 percent of casino players in Sri Lanka engage in online gambling making it nearly impossible for authorities to impose and collect taxes.

title: Colombo stock market extends gains amid renewed investor optimism
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its upward momentum today, supported by renewed investor sentiment and sustained buying interest across key sectors. Following yesterday’s mixed performance, both the All Share Price Index (ASPI) and the S&P SL20 advanced, reflecting improved market confidence

title: US updates travel advisory for Sri Lanka
byline: The U.S. Department of State has issued a travel advisory advising its citizens to exercise increased caution when travelling to Sri Lanka due to unrest, terrorism, and landmines.

title: Three police teams deployed to arrest lawyer Gunaratne Wanninayake: Police
byline: Three police teams have been deployed to arrest attorney-at-law Gunaratne Wanninayake, who was involved in a confrontation with a police constable at the Mount Lavinia Court premises, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) F.U. Wootler said today.

title: Education Ministry issues circular on Grade 6 admissions
byline: The Ministry of Education has issued a new circular regarding the admission of students to Grade 6 based on the results of the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination.

title: Madagascar military says it has seized power
byline: A Madagascar army colonel says that the military has taken charge of the African island nation after parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina.

title: Navy recovers major drug haul off southern coast
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has confirmed that 51 packages discovered floating in the seas off the southern coast contain crystal methamphetamine (‘ice’), hashish, and heroin.

title: Govt. to promote brown sugar among general public
byline: The government has taken steps to promote the use of locally produced brown sugar among the general public, aiming to strengthen and sustain the country’s domestic sugar industry, the Government Information Department said today.

title: Over 2,900 Sri Lankans depart for jobs in South Korea this year
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) announced that 2,927 Sri Lankans have left for employment opportunities in South Korea so far this year.
